alert.note: Alert for San Diego (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 10 at 2:26PM PST until January 10 at 7:00PM PST by NWS SanDiego
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM PST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of Southwest California, including the following county, San Diego. * WHEN...Until 600 PM PST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Dangerous flows over low-water crossings. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 226 PM PST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Alpine, Julian, Cuyamaca Rancho State Park, Hwy 78 Between Banner And S2, Mount Laguna, Hwy 78 Between S2 And Borrego Springs Rd, I-8 Between Pine Valley And Boulevard, Lake Cuyamaca, Hwy 79 Between Julian And Lake Cuyamaca and Hwy S1 Between Lake Cuyamaca And Mount Laguna. - https://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
